Compute the frequencies of features

Source: R/dfm_weight.R
featfreq.Rd

For a dfm object, returns a frequency for each feature, computed across all documents in the dfm. This is equivalent to colSums(x).

featfreq(x)

Arguments

x

a dfm

Value

a (named) numeric vector of feature frequencies

See also

dfm_tfidf(), dfm_weight()

Examples

dfmat <- dfm(tokens(data_char_sampletext))
featfreq(dfmat)
#>       instead            we          have             a          fine 
#>             1             5             1             4             1 
#>   gael-labour         party    government             ,        coming 
#>             1             1             4            16             1 
#>          into         power     promising          real        change 
#>             3             1             1             1             1 
#>           but     slavishly     following           the      previous 
#>             4             2             1            46             1 
#>  government’s        policy             .          that           has 
#>             1             4            14             8             4

#>             2             1             4             1             1 
#>           and           ecb           not            to          bail 
#>            20             1             4            11             1 
#>           out         irish        people       salvage        german 
#>             3             5             7             1             1 
#>        french       british         banks         those            of
